title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News

man rescued from derelict building fire in rotherham .
leeds study claims lack of sleep 'makes you fat ' .
new ferrari written off within one hour in south yorkshire .
woodhead pass pub owner concerned about closures .
bike racing in barnsley this evening .
snow load delivered to wakefield - in july ! .

documents.title: hull fc 43-24 leeds rhinos
text: hull fc 43-24 leeds rhinos
author: Andrew Aloia
BBC Sport

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: that 's all from the team today , but we 'll be back on monday from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
before we go , let 's look back at a selection of our top stories from today :
three former south yorkshire police officers facing charges in connection with the hillsborough disaster have asked for public funding to pay for their legal fees
a 20-year-old man who went on the run after being convicted of violent car-jackings in west yorkshire has been arrested
the high court judge overseeing sheffield city council 's bid for a court order to stop protests over tree felling in the city says he wo n't announce a judgement today
armed police patrols are being increased in huddersfield after a man was shot and a car damaged in two separate incidents in the town last night
famous leeds nightclub back to basics will join forces with opera north this evening
have a great weekend !
author: Oli Woodcock
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: woodhead pass pub owner concerned about closures
text: the owner of pub on the trans pennine woodhead pass says his business is being threatened by the road being shut for repairs or bad weather .

steve marsh is concerned its getting completely closed more often for maintenance or the weather at what he says is the `` whim '' of highways england and fears having to lay-off staff at the dog and partridge .
but the road operator says repairs to the road which links south yorkshire and mancester have be done and they 're working with business owners to minimise disruption .
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: your weather forecast for yorkshire
text: breezy with rain , occasionally heavy , spreading across all parts during the first half of the night .
this easing away east during the early hours of saturday , with clear spells following .
temperature lows of about 14c ( 57f ) .
a mostly dry and bright day to come on saturday with some decent spells of sunshine .
winds should ease a little but we could see a couple of well scattered showers .
feeling cool in the wind but pleasant in the sun with highs of about 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : the handiwork of sheffield 's river banksy is back
text: the work of a renegade artist in sheffield who likes to remain anonymous is back .
last year he installed some sculptures in the river don near blonk street in sheffield , and now he 's made some more :
author: Jenny Eells

documents.title: oxford united sign payne on loan
text: oxford united sign payne on loan

documents.title: government ban on diesel and petrol cars boost for sheffield firm
text: a sheffield firm could cash in following government moves to ban the sale of new diesel and petrol cars in the uk from 2040 .
i-t-m power , on atlas way have developed a component which helps to run hydrogen fuelled cars , which omit nothing but water .

documents.title: sheffield boeing factory prepares for lift-off
text: the world 's largest aerospace company , boeing , has been given a flying start in their move to sheffield , after planning officers at sheffield city council approved their multi-million pound plans today .

sheffield city council has approved the aerospace giant 's plans for a manufacturing and research building along with car parking and landscaping at sheffield business park , in the advanced manufacturing innovation district
other research buildings are in the process of being completed in the western corner of the site .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: family fun day at sheffield hallam university
text: no bored children at sheffield hallam university today .
crowds turned out for a family fun day to learn about the body , play virtual reality games , and race a robot around a maze .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: police sex-film pilot a 'taxi driver '
text: police sex-film pilot a 'taxi driver '

documents.title: skip hire firm fined for dumping in doncaster
text: the owner of a skip hire company has been fined £ 1,500 after a large amount of waste was found dumped in stainforth in doncaster .

mark addlesee of addlesee skips was prosecuted at doncaster magistrates court after an investigation by doncaster council 's enforcement team found rubbish being dumped on the site of a disused colliery in stainforth .
as well as the fine , he 's been ordered to cover the clean-up costs .

documents.title: man shot in huddersfield
text: armed police patrols are being increased in huddersfield after a man was shot and a car damaged in two separate incidents in the town last night .
a car passenger was treated in hospital and discharged after being shot in holays near bradley mills at about 20:52 - a man has been arrested .
officers were called to a second incident in new house road , deighton at about 22:04 in which a vw golf was damaged .

`` investigating recent firearms offences is my absolute number one priority residents will continue to see increased armed patrols in huddersfield and continued proactive disruption tactics against those suspected of involvement in gun and drugs crime. ``

documents.title: air quality in york is getting worse
text: air quality in the coppergate area of york is getting worse according to the council 's annual air quality report .
the report says there are increasing concentrations of nitrogen dioxide in the area .
air pollution in the city 's other two management areas has reduced over the last six years .

documents.title: rotherham town centre fire was accidental
text: south yorkshire fire service say the fire at howard street in this morning probably started accidently .
one man was taken to hospital after inhaling smoke - he was one of three people found to be sleeping rough in the derelict building .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: leeds surgeon gets on his bike for charity
text: a surgeon from saint james ' hospital in leeds is getting on his bike to raise money for charity today .
sunjay jain , who 's a bladder cancer surgeon , will ride 140 miles across the width of the country starting in cumbria and ending at the north sea in tynemouth .
the cash he raises will go to the charity yorkshire cancer research .

documents.title: missing west yorkshire girl thought to be in hull
text: police are urgently trying to find 12-year-old summer brewitt who is believed to be in hull .
she was reported missing from her home in huddersfield yesterday evening and is now thought to be in the east hull area , where she is known to have family .
summer is described as having long ginger hair and a fair complexion .
she was last seen wearing black jeans , a black jumper and green parka with fur .
police say they 're concerned for summer due to her age and need to confirm that she is safe .
anyone with information about her whereabouts is being asked to get in touch with police as soon as possible .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: hillsborough police officers want public funding for defence costs
text: three former south yorkshire police officers facing charges in connection with the hillsborough disaster have asked for public funding to pay for their legal fees .
south yorkshire police and crime commissioner alan billings says no decision on funding has been made yet .

the three officers seeking financial support are former ch supt david duckenfield ( below ) , who is facing a charge of manslaughter , former supt donald denton and former det chf insp alan foster , who are both charged with perverting the course of justice .

documents.title: three arrested after police pursuit
text: three men have been arrested after police searching for suspected burglars spotted a car believed to be stolen .

nottinghamshire police said three men thought to be wearing balaclavas and carrying weapons entered a house in sheffield early on thursday before fleeing in the car , which was seen by an officer on the a614 in ollerton .
the car was brought to a halt at burntstump hill in arnold at about 16:00 bst yesterday , and after the suspects fled on foot they were tracked down .
all three men have been taken back to south yorkshire for questioning .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: behind the scenes : excavating north yorkshire pow camp
text: an archaeological dig is taking place on the site of skipton 's first world war training and pow camp .
students from schools across the area are joining professional archaeologists for a week in august surveying and excavating part of the former raikeswood camp site .
the site was set up as a training camp for the bradford pals in 1915 and was later used as a pow camp for captured german officers .
the dig follows archaeological excavations which took place on the site of the camp last summer and unearthed a number of artefacts linked to the british and german occupation of the camp .
these included a trench whistle and a prussian ammunition pouch belt clasp .
the finds from the digs will be put on public display in an exhibition next spring about craven during the first world war at craven museum & gallery .

documents.title: footage shows bmw police chase
text: this footage showing officers chasing a stolen bmw has been released by police .
the car was taken after a gang broke into a house on hollin cross lane in glossop and stole the keys .
they also took bank cards , which they then used in sheffield - alerting police in the city .
the men appeared at derby crown court on wednesday , when ivor martin was jailed for 44 months , carl flowers for 43 months and ali luthfur for 38 months .
they all admitted burglary and taking the car without the owner 's consent in february .
martin and luthfur also admitted fraudulently using credit cards stolen during the burglary .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bradford carjackings : man on the run arrested
text: a 20-year-old man who went on the run after being convicted of violent car-jackings in west yorkshire has been arrested .
waqas hussain was given a 12 year jail sentence last week for threatening people with weapons and dragging them out of their cars in bradford .
one of his victims was a woman on her own who had her baby with her .
hussain was n't in court for the sentencing because he 'd gone on the run .
last night police found him at a house in heckmondwike - he 's now in custody .

documents.title: reflections of summer in york
text: how about this for a cracking reflection on york in the summer by a bbc weather watcher .
it 's petergate , a favourite with tourists , after a heavy shower .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: judgement on sheffield tree protesters 'in next two weeks '
text: the high court judge overseeing sheffield city council 's bid for a court order to stop protests over tree felling in the city says he wo n't announce a judgement today .
justice stephen males says he will make a judgement in the next two weeks - he 'll make the announcement in london .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: e-fit issued after woman attacked by man in huddersfield
text: police have released an e-fit image of a man they want to trace after a woman was grabbed in huddersfield .
the 26-year-old woman was grabbed on the arm by the man at around 4.15pm in stoney battery road , off manchester road in the town .
she had been walking down a path towards the canal when she was approached by the man last saturday .
this was clearly a distressing incident and officers have increased their patrols in the area to reassure the community .
the suspect is described as a black man , in his 20s , approximately 5ft 8in , tall and of muscular build . ''

documents.title: kilmarnock sign up striker erwin
text: kilmarnock sign up striker erwin

documents.title: sky to create new technology jobs in leeds
text: more technology jobs are being created in leeds by sky .
the firm says it 's going to increase its software engineering workforce by about a quarter and already employs 15 people at leeds dock near the royal armouries .
the broadcaster is yet to announce exactly how many new posts will come to the city .

documents.title: highest pub in britain up for sale
text: highest pub in britain up for sale

documents.title: sheffield police want to find this man - do you know him ?
text: detectives in sheffield are trying to find this man :
adam morton , aged 32 , from the woodthorpe area of the city is wanted y officers over a number of offences in the last two months .
police say he spends time in the manor top and frecheville areas and they want anyone who knows where he is to get in touch .

documents.title: festival ready for a world premiere
text: preparations are virtually complete for the bradford festival which starts today in city park and runs through to sunday .
one of the pieces it will showcase is the world premiere ice cream : the opera - which is on sunday .
bradford festival 's workshops and activities offer an amazing range of opportunities to learn new skills , meet and talk to people , and have fun . ''

documents.title: do you know these people ? police want to speak to them
text: detectives in leeds have released these cctv images of 11 people they want to trace after a serious brawl at a boxing event .
the disturbance happened at elland road football ground earlier this year .
officers say they want to speak to those in the as they may have important information about the incident in february .
two men and a woman were treated in hospital for minor injuries after the event .
i would appeal directly to any of the individuals to get in touch with police .
likewise , i would ask anyone who recognises those to contact officers with the information . ''

documents.title: great scot ! rare 1900 yorkshire cricket card could fetch £ 2,000
text: yorkshire 's victory in the 1900 county championships , their third in five years , was marked by the issue of the only known colour cigarette card of its type , by the glasgow tobacco company , d & j macdonald .
with only 10 thought to exist , it is a holy grail for hobbyists , and the auction of one on saturday is described as one of the rarest events on the collectors ' calendar .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: top cycling event in barnsley today
text: this evening barnsley plays host to high-tempo bike racing .
races will start and finish under the gaze of barnsley town hall and follow a circuit taking in the college , transport interchange and the short climb up market hill .
undefinedthere are five competitive races including youth , women 's and men 's events .
there is also an opportunity for children from age eight and adults to experience the thrill of riding the circuit with a community ride at 16:30 .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: leeds club night back to basics returns with classical twist
text: famous leeds nightclub back to basics will join forces with opera north this evening .
a concert will be held in millennium square to showcase some of the club 's dance anthems from its 26 year history .
these will be reworked and performed live by a 50 piece symphony orchestra .

documents.title: york woman given four years to live marks 30th anniversary of life-saving surgery
text: a york woman , who was given four years to live , is today marking the thirtieth anniversary of life-saving surgery .
carol town who suffers from the rare condition , eisenmenger 's syndrome , received a new heart and lungs .
the ground-breaking procedure was only expected to prolong her life by a few years .
but carol says her full life has confounded medical experts :
yesterday mrs town met the surgeon who gave her the live-saving operation , professor john wallwork , at a special ceremony at pembroke college in cambridge .

documents.title: homeless people sleeping in rotherham fire building
text: three homeless people were found to be sleeping in a derelict building on howard street in rotherham town centre where a fire spread this morning .
one man was rescued using a ladder from the four-storey building and is now recovering in hospital after inhaling smoke .
rotherham council say rough sleepers are a persistent problem .
a man 's been taken to hospital with smoke inhalation injuries following a fire at derelict college building on howard st in rotherham
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: tougher security for steeler games at sheffield arena
text: sheffield 's ice hockey fans can expect longer waiting times to get into steelers games at sheffield arena this season .
heightened security measures are in place in the wake of the manchester arena terror attack .
fans may be searched and are advised that no bag larger than an a4 piece of paper will be allowed in meaning a ban on rucksacks .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: ladder crew rescues one person from rotherham building fire
text: one person has been rescued from a burning building in the centre of rotherham this morning .
around 30 firefighters are dealing with the fire at the derelict building on howard street in rotherham town centre .
south yorkshire fire service were called out to the four-storey building at 08:40 this morning .

documents.title: barnsley sailor to skipper round-the-world racing yacht
text: a man from barnsley is to skipper a yacht taking part in a 40,000 mile race .
roy taylor spent 10 years working as a sailing instructor before being to lead the crew on a boat taking part in the clipper round the world yacht race
the race is described as the world 's greatest ocean challenge .
more than 700 non-professional sailors - representing over 40 nationalities - compete for 11 months on a fleet of 12 identical 70-foot ocean racing yachts .
the race starts in liverpool on sunday , 20 august and follows a global route which includes stopovers in cape town , sydney , seattle , panama , new york , and londonderry .

documents.title: police cyclists pay tribute to murdered colleague
text: police officers on a bike ride in memory of officer glenn goodman who was killed on duty 25 years ago have stopped to lay flowers at his memorial stone in tadcaster .
their 225-mile trip to the police national memorial in staffordshire began at york minster this morning .
glen goodman was on duty in north yorkshire when he was shot dead by an ira gunman .
currently stopped in tadcaster paying our respects to @ twitterid special constable glenn goodman # ukput # werideforthosewhodied
massive respect to the fallen

documents.title: breakingformer college building alight in rotherham
text: about 30 firefighters are tackling a fire at a derelict building in rotherham town centre .
a former rotherham college building is alight a spokeswoman for south yorkshire fire and rescue said they were called to the howard building this morning .
six fire engines are in attendance .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sweet smell of success : new chocolate factory to be launched in york
text: a new chapter is about to open in york 's chocolate history , with the launch of a york cocoa house city centre factory .
the city 's relationship with the sweet stuff began 250 years ago , with the opening of terry 's of york in 1767 .
that closed in 2005 , but now now there are plans to turn the old job centre on castlegate into a chocolate factory .
sophie jewitt who runs york 's cocoa house on blake street thinks her venture will produce 150 tonnes of chocolate a year .
plans for the site include a retail outlet , education centre and a cafe .
the total costs are estimated at £ 750,000 , with a crowdcube campaign being launched for the final £ 250,000 .
the venture is expected to create 20 jobs .

documents.title: major snowfall in wakefield
text: it looks as if there 's been a major snowfall in wakefield !
on this sunny friday morning the white stuff has appeared at the trinity walk shopping centre .
that 's because the centre are making a snow slope which will be open throughout the weekend .
here 's a sneak peek at the first few tons of snow it falls from a truck !

documents.title: on the right track : opera singer serenades rail commuters
text: people passing through selby railway station are getting a singing surprise this morning .
as part of the arts festival , commuters are being serenaded by an opera singer :
pop up opera at selby train station popera ?
it 's for @ twitterid and @ twitterid sounds incredible on @ twitterid this morning .
author: Jericho Keys
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: four teams , two semi-finals , one wembley aim
text: four teams , two semi-finals , one wembley aim

documents.title: schoolboy strides out to help injured jockeys
text: unlike most 11-year-old children spending their school holidays playing with friends or on computer games , jack lander has dedicated the first eight days of his time off to raising money for racing welfare .
he 's currently walking from newmarket to jack berry house in malton , north yorkshire , a rehabilitation facility for injured jockeys .
today is day six of his challenge .

jack 's due to arrive in malton on monday , where he 'll be greeted by jockeys and people from the racing community in malton , including retired jockey and trainer jack berry who broke 46 bones in his 16-year racing career .

documents.title: 'books on prescription ' scheme in york
text: from today people in york can get `` books on prescription '' with a project that is taking place at the city 's main library .
the scheme called books on prescription will see librarians and doctors team up to put four special health-related book collections together .
one of those collections is about dealing with common mental health issues while another is aimed at people dealing with dementia .
the event will also give people the chance to have their say on healthcare provision by talking to staff from the nhs vale of york clinical commissioning group .

documents.title: leeds study claims lack of sleep 'makes you fat '
text: a lack of sufficient sleep could make you fat a study by scientists in leeds has concluded .
the work by leeds institute of cardiovascular and metabolic medicine and the school of food science and nutrition involved over 1,600 adults who recorded how long they slept and what they ate .
the findings showed people who got an average of six hours sleep had a waist measurement 3cm greater and were heavier than those who got nine hours .
it 's claimed that insufficient sleep could contribute to type 2 diabetes , heart disease and a lack of so-called `` good '' cholesterol .

documents.title: charity cycle ride in memory of murdered policeman
text: a former colleague of murdered north yorkshire police officer glenn goodman is embarking on a charity cycle ride in his memory .
the 225-mile trip will begin at york minster .
at the front of a peloton of police officers will be cleveland police chief constable , iain spittal .
he was on duty in north yorkshire 25-years-ago when special constable glen goodman , was shot dead by an ira gunman .
the cyclists are heading for the national memorial in staffordshire .
on the way , they 'll meet glenn goodman 's parents as they lay flowers for the fallen officer in his home town of tadcaster .

documents.title: here 's what the weather has in store today
text: lucy martin has the weather forecast this morning :

documents.title: listen : hundreds expected for bradford counter-terrorism talk
text: hundreds of people are expected in bradford later to talk about how to tackle terrorism .
mohammed shafiq of the ramadan foundation says it 's time for people of different faiths to condemn the attacks .
he believes communities need to come together to discuss the problem :

documents.title: new ferrari written off within one hour
text: a driver who had owned a £ 200,000 ferrari for just one hour lost control of the vehicle which careered off a motorway and burst into flames .
the powerful ferrari 430 scuderia was reduced to a twisted wreck after the smash on the m1 near junction 37 in south yorkshire on thursday afternoon .
police said the car `` went airborne '' in the wet conditions .
the driver walked away with just cuts and bruises .
the car went 50 metres down a bank and ended up in a field , where it turned into a fireball and the fire had to be extinguished by firefighters .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch a train this morning you 'll be glad to know the services across our region all seem to be running largely to time at the moment .
you can click on the links below to keep up to date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on friday 28 july 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
the forecast for today suggests a little more sun and less rain than of late so i thought we 'd start with a of beauty and a suggestion of hope .
this was taken just before sunrise over scarborough 's south bay .
if you have something interesting to share you can do so by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
